result.title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise: Downgrade To Hold On Growth Concerns
result.text: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company is downgraded to Hold due to margin pressure and muted segment growth despite AI and Juniper Networks acquisition. HPE's fiscal 2025 saw revenue rise 13%, but gross margin stagnated at 30% and net loss reached $437 million, impacted by a $1.6 billion impairment. Networking segment growth was acquisition-driven; four of five segments posted revenue declines, and management guides 510% revenue growth for 2026, below AI peers.

result.title: HPE forecasts fiscal 2026 results below estimates, shares fall
result.text: Hewlett Packard Enterprise forecast annual profit and revenue below Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, as it shifts its server business toward artificial intelligence and networking following its Juniper Networks acquisition.

result.title: HPE stock sinks 10% on weak guidance for fiscal 2026
result.text: At a meeting with analysts, Hewlett Packard Enterprise issued disappointing guidance for its fiscal 2026. The company said adjusted earnings per share in fiscal 2026 will be $2.20 to $2.40, while analysts were expecting $2.40, according to LSEG.

result.title: HPE Expects Revenue Growth to Slow in Next Fiscal Year
result.text: The technology company expects revenue to grow between 5% to 10% for fiscal 2026 as it targets higher-growth businesses to improve profit.

result.title: HPE's $14 billion Juniper acquisition could face state challenge
result.text: A group of U.S. states said they may seek to block Hewlett-Packard Enterprise's $14 billion acquisition of Juniper Networks and have asked a judge for permission to intervene in a case where the U.S. Department of Justice has proposed to settle and let the deal move forward.

result.title: HPE Gains From Server Refresh Cycle: Sign of More Growth?
result.text: Hewlett Packard Enterprise's record Server revenues, powered by AI demand and the global server refresh cycle, point to continued growth momentum into 2026.

result.title: Nokia to license technology from HPE to advance its AI-powered SMO and network automation assets
result.text: Press ReleaseNokia to license technology from HPE to advance its AI-powered SMO and network automation assets Agreement includes licensing technology assets to enhance Nokia's MantaRay SMO portfolio to boost customer experience. result.title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise: Equity Story Has Fundamentally Shifted For The Better
result.text: Hewlett Packard Enterprise is rated a buy, as the Juniper acquisition transforms it into a networking and AI infrastructure leader. The Juniper deal accelerates HPE's shift to higher-growth, higher-margin networking, with networking now expected to drive over 50% of operating profit. AI systems and hybrid cloud momentum, especially with Alletra MP and GreenLake, are fueling robust revenue growth and margin expansion for HPE.
